item.title: 90s TV
item.description: /c/90s TV on lemmy.sdf.org https://lemmy.sdf.org/c/90s_tv Description A place to recommend, review, discuss, and geek out over 90s TV shows, mini-series, and made for TV movies. ### Rules They aren't strict. Just try to keep posts on topic of 90s TV, and of course decade appropriate. ### TV Guide - **Saturdays**: [Saturday Morning Cartoons](https://lemmy.sdf.org/post/76174) Details * Subscribers 37 Posts 12 Comments 10 Daily Active Users 4 Weekly Active Users 8 Monthly Active Users 8 Published 2023-06-11 06:07:32 Updated 2023-06-15 19:58:05 Last Scraped 2023-06-16 11:06:04

item.title: BBS
item.description: /c/BBS on lemmy.sdf.org https://lemmy.sdf.org/c/bbs Description The place where Bulletin Board Systems live on! --- **Post / Comment Guidelines** - Don't Spam. - Don't be a jerk. - Read the FAQ (TODO :)) when it's ready. --- Reminisce with [The BBS Documentary](http://www.bbsdocumentary.com/), viewable online [here](http://archive.org/details/BBS.The.Documentary). --- Find one of hundreds of BBSes running **today** using the lists found at [The Telnet BBS Guide](http://www.telnetbbsguide.com/), [BBS Guide](http://bbs.guide/), or [IPTIA BBS Resource Site](https://www.ipingthereforeiam.com/bbs/). ---

item.title: DND Memes
item.description: /c/DND Memes on lemmy.sdf.org https://lemmy.sdf.org/c/dndmemes Description For memes related to DND. Current Rules: 1) Don't be a jerk. 2) Must be a meme related to Dungeons and Dragons and/or TTRPG in a relatable context. 3) Be civil. Just because you do not agree with an opinion expressed in a meme does not mean that you have to attempt to blast the OP down in a personal manner. See rule 1.

item.title: Doomers
item.description: /c/Doomers on lemmy.sdf.org https://lemmy.sdf.org/c/doomers Description **Musings and discussion surrounding the end of human civilization** *** **Guidelines:** - Anyone can post - Keep discussion civil and be respectful of others - Keep content on-topic - Appropriately label any NSFW content - Do not post bigoted or hateful speech, nor incite violence or encourage criminal behavior - Do not harass others - Do not post extreme or offensive content - Violations of any guideline will be subject to removal of post, public or private admonition, or temporary or permanent user removal at the discretion of any moderator

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: /c/Hello World! on lemmy.sdf.org https://lemmy.sdf.org/c/helloworld Description Got a new thing you want to share? Announce it here. We'd love to hear about it. Some Guidelines: 1. When in doubt, assume the poster posted with the best intentions. Language is hard. Communication is harder. 2. Don't be an asshole. Constructive criticism is fine. But seriously, if you can't say something nice: go somewhere else. 3. NSFW content is fine, but please mark it as such.

item.title: Living in vans, cars, RVs, etc
item.description: /c/Living in vans, cars, RVs, etc on lemmy.sdf.org https://lemmy.sdf.org/c/houseless Description We're not homeless, we're houseless! By choice or by circumstance we are living in our vehicles. Don't worry about us -- it can be a very good life. Anything that affects us _as vehicle-dwellers_ is probably on topic. # external resources - [emergency guide to suddenly living in a vehicle](https://rvwiki.mousetrap.net/doku.php?id=lifestyle:involuntary) <-- start here if you don't have a choice in the matter

item.title: Mac Gaming
item.description: /c/Mac Gaming on lemmy.sdf.org https://lemmy.sdf.org/c/macgaming Description Welcome to the Mac Gaming Community! This is a place for all Mac gamers to discuss, share, and enjoy the world of gaming on macOS. Whether you're a casual player or a dedicated enthusiast, we welcome you to join our community and share your passion for Mac gaming! Rules Be respectful and civil. Treat others how you'd like to be treated. Personal attacks, harassment, and hate speech will not be tolerated.

item.title: retro NET - Vintage Sites/Fads/Software/Games/Memes
item.description: /c/retro NET - Vintage Sites/Fads/Software/Games/Memes on lemmy.sdf.org https://lemmy.sdf.org/c/retronet Description Community for discussing internet and software topics that are 20+ years old. Topics can be sites/fads/software/games/memes or any general happenings that used to occur on computers way back in the day. Submission Guidelines: 1) Topic of discussion should have originated 20+ years ago. A topic (such as a fad or web game) that originated 20 years ago but remained popular for a couple years is ok, as long as it first began 20+ years ago.

Rules: 1> Vintage is in the eye of the beholder but probably pre 2000s is a safe bet. 2> Discussion of new release of old shows is welcome 3> Discussion of unofficial releases should be limited to shows that are not currently available outside of Japan otherwise.
